Posts.Content: VegasKat wrote: I will be having a lumpectomy procedure later this Month (Nov 2009) to remove two areas (one is an intraductal papilloma and the other is radial scar) that were previously biopsied which came back benign.  At the biopsy, they inserted the two metal clips in my breast.  My question is:  when I have my lumpectomy surgery will I still need to have the wire guided procedure done prior to the actual surgery or will the two metal clips be enough to guide my surgeon for the surgery?  I know they will be doing a second biopsy of all the removed tissue and areas of concern just to be sure they didn't "miss" anything on the first biopsy.  I forgot to ask my surgeon this question at our last appointment.  I also asked him how much of my breast would be removed and he told me he wouldn't know until he got in there...has anyone else heard that before?    Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy Surgery Question VegasKat vtmom

Posts.Content: Nov 13, 2009 05:03AM VegasKat wrote: Thank you for your comments regarding my question....this is my very first surgery of any kind.  I am 42 years old, never had any children.  I've only been "put under" once about 20 years ago for my wisdom teeth to be removed.  I can't believe I've made it this far being such a "baby" that I claim to be. Hate needles!  But after 1 mammogram, 1 ultrasound, 1 ductogram, 1 MRI and then another MRI for the biopsy....I guess I am not so scared of needles after all....it's all part of the ride!   I just might be stronger than I thoughtl.  Good idea to call the doc's office....I will call my surgeon's office and speak to his assistant and find out if there is any pre-op appointment at the hospital prior to my surgery or maybe just ask her some questions. Just waiting for the insurance to authorize the surgery...I've been waiting for all of this to "end" since July 2009...it seems to be a long "ride" (one I didn't exactly want to get on like the rest of the ladies on this board)...I guess I won't know for sure if my "ride" will be over until the last biopsy after my lumpectomy.  Thanks for your support!
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy Surgery Question VegasKat vtmom

Posts.Content: Nov 15, 2009 11:58AM VegasKat wrote: Thank you for all of the wonderful comments.  It seems that everyone's experience is a little different so I will defintely have to speak to my surgeon prior to my lumpectomy to find out exactly what procedures he will use.  My question was raised because I had previously ready some other comments from ladies indicating that the wire procedure caused them some anxiety, discomfort and pain.  I was hoping to alleviate that, however, I think that after all of the needles and poking and prodding I've already been through, I should be able to handle this.  Thanks again for taking the time to answer my question.  I would appreciate all comments and experiences, especially any post-surgery comments like what I should expect after the surgery.
